sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This is Euronews Tonight. Here are your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russia claims that over 1,700 Ukrainian fighters have surrendered from the Azov-style steel plant as concerns grow that Moscow could seek to annex areas seized in the southeast of the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: G7 finance ministers meet in Germany in a race to secure more aid for Ukraine and avert an impending food crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Euronews speaks to Britain's Home Secretary Priti Patel about controversial plans to send undocumented migrants to Rwanda and what that could mean for Ukrainians in the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And the stars are out in force on the red carpet in the south of France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We'll have all the latest from the Cannes Film Festival.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I'm Helena Humphrey. Good to have you with us. Russia claims that over 1,700 Ukrainian troops

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: have surrendered from the Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol, including 771 in the last 24 hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Well, pro-Russian separatists say that this represents over half of Azovstal's resistance forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Ukraine's military is warning Moscow is trying to consolidate defensive positions in the south.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This comes as one Russian military official revealed plans to annex occupied regions in southeastern Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Our international correspondent, Anneliese Borges, has been with the Ukrainian forces who are defending the southern front, and she has this report.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Far from them, why?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Because they can shoot to us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Approaching the fighting on Ukraine's southern fronts is a delicate task. We negotiated for days to be allowed to come here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Deputy Commander Nazar is taking us in.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: He's in charge of a battalion of over 500 men trying to retake the city of Kherson, the first to be occupied by Russian troops at the start of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: When was this hit?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Yesterday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Yesterday. The fighting has been fierce, he says, showing us the site of the latest strike 24 hours ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: They deliberately destroy infrastructure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: They want to sow panic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: They think that by destroying cities and villages, they will be able to intimidate people, intimidate civilians, intimidate the military, but they won't succeed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Over the last three months, Nazar's men have been able to contain Russia's incursion in the area surrounding Kherson.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: When asked if they had the right weaponry and ammunition to keep going, Nazar said they have something even more important.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Resolve. The Armed Forces of Ukraine are more combat ready than ever.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: When the enemy began shelling Ukrainian lands at night, many men simply broke down the doors of our enlistment offices to go to defend their land.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Each of my soldiers, and I know for sure that we will not only go to Kherson, but also to the Ukrainian Crimea and the Ukrainian Donbass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: and the Ukrainian Donbass. We move to some of the positions occupied by soldiers nearby.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: These trenches have just been dug and are supposed to offer defence capability.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: We are a few hundred metres from the line of contact. This trench is for a unit. See the line of defense over there. Here are the lines of defense.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Units take up defense and protect the settlement if the enemy wants to approach.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: But Russians are running little by little. We kick them out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: They are running little by little. We kick them out. They are running away?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Yes, they must go home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Because you are pushing them away?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Yeah.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian government says it will not accept a ceasefire until Russian troops withdraw from the country's territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Here, Ukrainian soldiers say they are braced for a long fight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It's relatively quiet right now. Does that worry you?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Yes, that's why we need to move.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Annalise Borges from southern Ukraine for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Thank you, Jacqueline.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: G7 finance ministers and central banking chiefs are meeting in Germany to discuss the economic fallout from the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: German finance minister Kristian Lindner said that they're hoping to agree on around 14 billion euros in aid to help sustain Kyiv's war effort.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Also on the agenda at the two-day summit, how to address soaring global food and energy prices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Earlier today, the UN warned that the war in Ukraine could lead to years of malnutrition, mass hunger and famine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Both Russia and Ukraine are big exporters of wheat, barley and sunflower oil.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Let's get more now on this summit with our reporter Jona Kallagren,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: who's standing by for us this evening in Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Good evening to you, Jona. Good to see you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Is a deal for a Ukraine package in sight at the moment?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And what could it look like?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Well, listen, I'll explain the problem, first of all.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And that is that the Ukrainian economy is obviously in severe severe decline and it has problems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And that means that the government is currently running a deficit of about five billion dollars per month. And that money needs to come from somewhere in order for the government to continue to function paying staff and paying government employees and so on. Now, the G7 meeting here is really focused to a large extent on that. And the EU has already pledged about nine billion dollars. And the U.S. is looking at pledging a similar amount. And that would mean that the functioning of the government in the Kiev could continue for several months, not endlessly, of course.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This will mean that they could continue, you know, past the summer at this stage. But it would obviously give them a reprieve, you know, a bit of breathing space, and let them focus on the war and let the G7 finance ministers focus on helping them with funds of course the g7 then find themselves meeting at not just a difficult time of course for Ukraine but the international backdrop to all of this when we're looking at surging food prices surging energy prices and have they been discussing a way to tackle that and what does that look like well they have indeed they have INFLATION, AND HOW THAT IS HITTING THE WORLD AT THE FINANCE MINISTERS MEETING. AND ALSO SIMULTANEOUSLY, THERE IS ANOTHER MEETING HAPPENING, THAT IS THE G7 DEVELOPMENT MINISTERS MEETING AND THE G7 HEALTH MINISTERS MEETING. AND THEY ARE ALSO LOOKING AT THIS PARTICULAR ISSUE, PARTICULARLY WHEN IT COMES TO THE FOOD CRISIS AROUND THE WORLD.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: PRICES ARE SOARING, AND WE ARE SEEING A LOT OF PEOPLE GOING THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT IS LOOKING AT THE FOOD CRISIS AND THE FOOD CRISIS IN THE WORLD.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: THEY ARE ALSO LOOKING AT THIS PARTICULAR ISSUE, PARTICULARLY WHEN IT COMES TO THE FOOD CRISIS AROUND THE WORLD.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: PRICES ARE SOARING AS A DIRECT EFFECT OF THE WAR IN UKRAINE, THE RUSSIAN INVASION OF UKRAINE.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: WHAT THEY ARE LOOKING AT IS COMING UP WITH A PLAN WHERE THEY ARE COORDINATING BETWEEN coordinating, you know, between the G7 countries and other countries and also providing funds to focus specifically on that issue. And the goal is obviously to make sure that the crisis that we have now, the food insecurity, doesn't turn into something worse, which would be a hunger crisis where people are starving across the world. Jona Kellgren this evening reporting from Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Yona, as ever, good to talk to you. Thank you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Now, some Ukrainians living in the UK

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: say that they're worried about the government's plan to send people who have entered the country illegally to Rwanda.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Home Secretary, Priti Patel, told Euronews there's no reason why there should be undocumented Ukrainians in the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Luke Hanrahan sent us this report from London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Those who travel to the UK by illegal and dangerous routes, including by small boats across the channel, may be relocated to Rwanda where they will have their asylum claims considered.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The UK government has struck a deal with Rwanda, the UK paying for all people seeking asylum who are deemed to have arrived illegally to be sent to the Central African country for processing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Priti Patel, the Home Secretary, made a recent trip to Rwanda to sign the contract and to examine the accommodation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But for these London-based Ukrainian volunteers, there is concern.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: As we were filming, at this support hub, an undocumented Ukrainian family arrived to ask for advice. Understandably, they didn't want to be filmed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: They're very worried because I have a huge stress on trying to...

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Max, who supports refugees, says he knows a large number of undocumented Ukrainians living in London, and the community as a whole here is concerned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I can't imagine just somebody taking me and taking me to another continent with a completely different culture so far away from everything I know and leaving my life here. I don't think any of us would want to be in that situation so why should we be putting these people in that situation?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The reason Ukrainian refugees are drawn to the UK is in large part because there's a substantial Ukrainian population here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But due to an administrative backlog, many visa applications are yet to be processed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's meant some have decided to enter the UK via the back door.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Ireland lifted visa requirements for Ukrainians, meaning refugees who arrive there can enter the UK via Northern Ireland through the open border arrangement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: In response to the question, could undocumented Ukrainians who've entered the UK illegally be sent to Rwanda for processing, the government has confirmed that this is technically how the system could work, something which has been welcomed by some members of Parliament in Boris Johnson's Conservative Party, a system they believe will deter illegal immigrants. I think it's going to serve as a huge deterrent. Andrew Bridgen is a Conservative member of Parliament who supports the government's Rwanda plan. We're gonna have laws to make it easier to deport foreign criminals and I think it is important that including those foreign criminals are people who've committed the criminal act of entering the UK illegally and undocumented.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But Priti Patel, the Home Secretary, told me the UK's Ukrainian visa programme makes it unnecessary for Ukrainians to travel here illegally in the first place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: There is no reason why they should be undocumented. They are here legitimately and legally, as you've heard me say.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But if they are undocumented?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: One through our visa route and secondly, through their status in the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The other point about Rwanda, which is a migration and economic development partnership, it actually addresses the wider issue about illegal migration.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The government designed this policy to deter migrants who take the dangerous decision to travel across the English Channel. The fact that it also applies to undocumented Ukrainians may be an unintended but extreme consequence of this new law. Luke Hanrahan, Euronews, London. The Ukrainian army is mounting successful counter-attacks in the country's south.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Our international correspondent Anneliese Borges has been embedded with the troops on the front line and joins us now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Anneliese, good to see you. Welcome to the program.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We saw you there on one of the front lines. You were embedded with the troops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: What is the situation where you are right now?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Well, Odessa is a bit of a safe haven near the most dangerous areas from this region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Much of the coordination of the war efforts here in the south is being organized, but it only takes a two-hour drive to actually see a very, very different picture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: To the east of the city of Mykolaiv, that is where those multiple fronts are being waged, the fighting is being w is where those multiple fronts are being waged, the fighting is being waged on these multiple fronts. We spent some time yesterday with a group of soldiers, one battalion that is currently trying to retake the city of Kherson. And it was very interesting to see how they are still in high spirits. They were talking about their determination to retake head song and also other areas. They insist is only a matter of time that they have what it takes and that they will continue fighting. And even though the situation was relatively calm while we were there with them near those front lines shortly after we left the region and attempted to do a live hit with one of those shows, we were actually told to leave because the shelling had resumed once again. Now, Anneliese, concerns are being raised about Moscow's intentions for the southeast of the country, whether indeed it may even plan to annex it, particularly in light of a visit from the deputy Russian prime minister. What more can DEPUTY RUSSIAN PRIME MINISTER. WHAT MORE CAN YOU TELL US ABOUT THAT? WE HAVE HEARD NEWS THAT THE RUSSIAN INSTORED AUTHORITIES IN GERSON WERE PLANNING ON FILING A MOTION AND REQUEST MOSCOW TO ANNEX THAT ENTIRE AREA A COUPLE OF DAYS AGO, ACTUALLY, AND NOW THE NEWS THAT THESE RUSSIAN DELEGATIONS MIGHT BE HEADING TO THAT AREA. and now the news that these Russian delegations might be heading to that area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: That is likely to hinder peace negotiations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We've heard from the chief advisor to the Ukrainian president, Volodymyr Zelensky, earlier today saying that there will be no ceasefire unless all Russian soldiers leave Ukrainian territory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And that is likely going to take some time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As to how the news of this visit is playing here among soldiers, well, we've spoken to some of the troops who said it changes nothing to them. They will continue fighting. And even if those regions are annexed, well, they will retake them, not only Red Son, but also the Donbass in the east of the country and also Crimea, which was, of course, annexed back in 2014.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And of course, Anneliese, as you are aware, attention around the world has been fixed on the Azovstal steel plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Kremlin now saying that around 1,700 Ukrainian fighters there have surrendered.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: What is the latest that we're hearing out of that operation in Mariupol?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: out of that operation in Mariupol?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Well, we understand that the Red Cross has been registering those soldiers that have been evacuated from the Azovstal steel plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They are actually registering them as prisoners of war at the request of both parties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: According to the organization, they have registered hundreds of prisoners.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They have not cited the exact number, but they say they have their information, their date of birth and other classified information that is according to international law. Those interviews must remain confidential. The Red Cross is adamant that they are not moving. They're not transporting those soldiers to the place where they're being detained.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: transporting those soldiers to the place where they're being detained. It's a very difficult situation to verify. Of course, Ukrainian authorities have not confirmed those numbers, but they are saying that they hope those prisoners are going to be part of a prisoner swap deal with Russia in the coming days. Russia, however, has said that they are planning to interrogate all those prisoners and determine whether or not they had any kind of involvement in crimes against civilians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Annelies Borges reporting from Odessa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Our international correspondent, Annelies, good to talk to you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Thank you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In the UK, the police probe into the so-called partygate scandal is over, with Downing Street saying that no further action will be taken against the Prime Minister, Boris Johnson.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Some people who breached Covid restrictions at gatherings across government departments and Number 10 received more than one penalty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A total of 126 fines were issued for 83 individuals, and opposition Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer is now calling on Mr Johnson to publish the full Sougray report.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Police in northern Germany say they have arrested a suspect in connection with a shooting at a school in Bremerhaven that seriously wounded one woman.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Students reportedly used tables and chairs to barricade themselves in the classrooms after a man fired multiple shots at Lloyd Gymnasium Secondary School. Local media say he used a crossbow in the attack while other reports say he also had a handgun. Spain has become the latest European country

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: to report cases of monkeypox, a rare viral infection usually found in western Central Africa. Recent cases have also been found in Portugal, England and the US. Two of the latest cases in England have no travel links. Katie Dartford reports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Suspected or confirmed cases of monkeypox have now been reported in the United States, Canada and several European countries. The outbreak of the rare viral infection that's related to smallpox is unusual for a disease typically limited to Africa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Portuguese health authorities have confirmed several cases in young men.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Portugal, through the General Directorate for Health, confirmed that in this month there has been more than 20 suspected cases of monkeypox infections, both in the Lisbon region as well as other regions, if I'm not incorrect. The region is called Valle de Tejo, in which they already have a positive diagnosis in their national reference center. What we are seeing in these suspicious cases is that they have a common element, that is that they are cases that have been in the region of Madrid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They have not traveled to areas of Africa, which is where this virus usually circulates, and they have not traveled to the countries that have issued the first cases, the United Kingdom and Portugal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Sporadic cases of the virus have been seen previously in Britain and the US, but nearly all have been in people who were likely infected during their travels to Africa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Now, Hollywood actor Tom Cruise received a warm welcome on the red carpet of the 75th Cannes Film Festival.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The glitz and glamour has firmly returned to the world's leading cinema gathering, as Mark Armstrong reports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The big event at the start of the Cannes Film Festival was the arrival of Tom Cruise on the red carpet. The Hollywood star was in town for the screening of Top Gun Maverick, the long-awaited sequel to the 1986 blockbuster. A large crowd turned out to welcome Cruz who was accompanied by actress Jennifer Connelly and other members of the cast and crew and by way of an official welcome a surprise flyover by French fighter jets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: A legend among US Navy fighter pilots Pete Maverick Mitchell continues to push his limits as a test pilot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: He's tasked with training a detachment of young Top Gun graduates for a special mission that no pilot would ever have imagined.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: On one hand, the Cannes Film Festival is split with blockbusters such as Top Gun Maverick with Tom Cruise, the quintessential Hollywood star system and, on the other hand, much lower budget films from all over the world that are often of high quality.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: For example, the Belgian film La Haute Montagne, directed by Felix von Groningen and Charlotte van der Mersch, a story of friendship and destiny in the Italian Alps.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: While Bruno remains faithful to his mountain, Pietro travels the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: On the journey, they experience love and loss, their origins and destinies, but above all, a lifelong friendship.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Also in the running at the start of the festival is Tchaikovsky's wife, a magnificent portrait of the composer's spouse in late 19th-century Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: It's expected the film will take some of the honours, at least for its dazzling direction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It tells the story of Antonina Milyukova, a wealthy and brilliant young woman who falls into madness with her boundless and blind love for the composer Tchaikovsky, who had a secret to hide.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We leave you with a no comment from Djerba in Tunisia, where crowds of worshippers attend the annual Jewish pilgrimage at the Griba synagogue. Thanks for watching Euronews tonight.... Merci Ã  vous.
